newsitem.title: UK: BAA to raise London airport fees April 1.
newsitem.headline: BAA to raise London airport fees April 1.

text.p: British airport operator BAA said it will increase from April 1 its average landing, passenger and parking charges in line with a formula laid down by its regulator, the Civil Aviation Authority (CAA).
Landing fees at Gatwick and Stansted have been increased by more than at London Heathrow which remains the most expensive of BAA's three London airports.
This is the first year of the five-year formula restricting the average rise in charges to three percent less than the UK retail price index.
Landing fees at Heathrow for planes over 50 tonnes are up by between five and seven stg with a top rate of 585 stg for peak time landing for noisy Chapter 2 planes which carry a 30 percent surcharge.

Fees at Gatwick for a Chapter 2 over 50 tonnes are 19.5 stg higher at 422.50 stg. At Stansted the charge structure has been altered so next week Chapter 2 planes over 250 tonnes will pay 195 stg plus 4.55 stg a tonne of the total weight of the aircraft. Previously the charge for ones over 50 tonnes was 111.80 stg plus 4.55 stg a tonne for each tonne above 50 tonnes.
